thread.title: David Cassidy charged in Florida mishap
thread.title_full: David Cassidy charged in Florida mishap

title: David Cassidy charged in Florida mishap
text:
David Cassidy charged in Florida mishap Celebrity's lawyer disputes police version of events Published On: Oct 04 2015 03:08:30 AM CDT Updated On: Oct 04 2015 12:33:07 PM CDT St. Lucie County Sheriff's Department 
His profile rose again, for the wrong reasons, thanks to a November 2010 DUI arrest in Florida. FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. - 
Former "Partridge Family" star David Cassidy has been charged by authorities in Florida with leaving the scene of a traffic accident last month. 
The Broward County State Attorney's Office charged Cassidy, 65, of Fort Lauderdale, Wednesday with leaving the scene of the Sept. 9 accident, driving with an expired tag, improper lane change and driving with a suspended license, the SunSentinel reported Friday. 
The entertainment news website TMZ reported a witness told police Cassidy stopped after sideswiping a truck on Interstate 595 but then attempted to cover up his license plate before driving away with a flat tire. TMZ said it tried to reach Cassidy but had not heard back from him. Quick Clicks
